physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a bride and groom
 in a suit and wedding dress
 seated in the backseat of a vehicle. The bride is holding a bouquet of flowers. They are both facing towards the camera. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a bride and groom, in a suit and wedding dress, seated in the backseat of a vehicle. The bride is holding a bouquet of flowers. They are both facing towards the camera. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
